intro: Trithecanthera superba, commonly known as the golden wattle, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow floral spikes. The plant features compound leaves with three leaflets, and its flowers are typically arranged in dense, cylindrical clusters. Trithecanthera superba is known for its ability to fix nitrogen in the soil, making it an important plant in ecological restoration. It is also a symbol of Australian biodiversity and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands.
